messages.text:
I'm trying to build ImarisWriter with binary builder. cmake finds the HDF5 libraries fine on Linux but cannot find the libraries on Windows.

<https://github.com/JaneliaSciComp/ImarisWriter/blob/4a144799881217696ec376f4c11573da49bf105b/CMakeLists.txt#L34|https://github.com/JaneliaSciComp/ImarisWriter/blob/4a144799881217696ec376f4c11573da49bf105b/CMakeLists.txt#L34>

It appears that the DLLs in HDF_jll are named distinct from what CMake expects on Windows. What is the best approach?

elements.text: I'm trying to build ImarisWriter with binary builder. cmake finds the HDF5 libraries fine on Linux but cannot find the libraries on Windows.
It appears that the DLLs in HDF_jll are named distinct from what CMake expects on Windows. What is the best approach?

messages.text: manage to cross-compile HDF5 :slightly_smiling_face:
good luck with that
Is there something wrong with current binaries in HDF5_jll?

elements.text: Is there something wrong with current binaries in HDF5_jll?

messages.text: HDF5 can't be crosscompiled, we use binaries from Anaconda.  if there is something wrong with them, you know who to blame :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: HDF5 can't be crosscompiled, we use binaries from Anaconda.  if there is something wrong with them, you know who to blame

messages.text: Got it. Blame Anaconda for why this is messed up.

elements.text: Got it. Blame Anaconda for why this is messed up.

messages.text: So I'll probably just patch / hack the CMake config for Windows and try to proceed from there.

messages.text:
soooo, some musl fun: `XML2_jll` depends on `Libiconv_jll`:
```shell> ldd /root/.julia/artifacts/0a291a85f151f34baf4a09d3a4c4f1c0035c3cc2/lib/libxml2.so
        /lib/ld-musl-x86_64.so.1 (0x7f5b8303a000)
        libz.so.1 => /lib/libz.so.1 (0x7f5b82ca3000)
Error loading shared library libiconv.so.2: No such file or directory (needed by /root/.julia/artifacts/0a291a85f151f34baf4a09d3a4c4f1c0035c3cc2/lib/libxml2.so)
        libc.musl-x86_64.so.1 => /lib/ld-musl-x86_64.so.1 (0x7f5b8303a000)
Error relocating /root/.julia/artifacts/0a291a85f151f34baf4a09d3a4c4f1c0035c3cc2/lib/libxml2.so: libiconv: symbol not found
Error relocating /root/.julia/artifacts/0a291a85f151f34baf4a09d3a4c4f1c0035c3cc2/lib/libxml2.so: libiconv_open: symbol not found
Error relocating /root/.julia/artifacts/0a291a85f151f34baf4a09d3a4c4f1c0035c3cc2/lib/libxml2.so: libiconv_close: symbol not found```
but
```julia> using Libiconv_jll

julia> libiconv
"/root/.julia/artifacts/a68e58e626bcb8e54e199795c726164f206f4f06/lib/libiconv.so"```
it's `libiconv.so`, not `libiconv.so.2`.  with glibc we have the same relationships and names, but the loader doesn't have problems finding the soversioned library.  so, is this a limitation of musl?  not being able to load xml2 cuts out more than 500 packages: <https://juliahub.com/ui/Packages/XML2_jll/xWVg2/2.9.11+0?t=2> :grimacing:

I’m not sure if this is the right channel to ask for help. I had an experiment project based on CxxWrap.jl to see how to build the Julia wrapper for C++ codes. I’m not a C++ guy, just learned it two weeks ago so I bet there must be many places that I did improperly, I wish someone could help take a look at the project and give some suggestions.

Here’s the project repo: <https://github.com/johnnychen94/CxxWrap_example> The unit test passes so it works at least, just that I don’t know if I’m doing it effectively.

I’m trying to figure out how to build the Julia interface to Halide project for this year’s GSoC, so any feedback and suggestions would be very helpful. (To not take seats from our Julia community, I plan to apply in the halide community <https://github.com/halide/Halide/discussions/5824>. :laughing: )

messages.text:
Hi! I have the following question about "replacing" one jll with another.
The SQLite.jl package uses SQLite_jll (obviously :) ). Suppose I want to use a version of SQLite that supports encryption, so I compile it and package as SQLiteCipher_jll. It is a drop-in replacement, so I'd like to just point SQLite.jl to this jll. Is something like this possible without creating a copy of SQLite.jl with this single change?

elements.text:
Hi! I have the following question about "replacing" one jll with another.
The SQLite.jl package uses SQLite_jll (obviously :) ). Suppose I want to use a version of SQLite that supports encryption, so I compile it and package as SQLiteCipher_jll. It is a drop-in replacement, so I'd like to just point SQLite.jl to this jll. Is something like this possible without creating a copy of SQLite.jl with this single change?

Does anyone happen to know why?

Has anyone seen a build error like this before?
```In file included from /opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/linux/byteorder/little_endian.h:13:0,
                 from /opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/asm/byteorder.h:5,
                 from /opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/linux/perf_event.h:20,
                 from libbpf.c:36:
/opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/linux/swab.h:161:1: error: unknown type name ‘__always_inline’
 static __always_inline __u16 __swab16p(const __u16 *p)
 ^
/opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/linux/swab.h:161:30: error: expected ‘=’, ‘,’, ‘;’, ‘asm’ or ‘__attribute__’ before ‘__swab16p’
 static __always_inline __u16 __swab16p(const __u16 *p)
                              ^
/opt/x86_64-linux-musl/x86_64-linux-musl/sys-root/usr/include/linux/swab.h:174:1: error: unknown type name ‘__always_inline’
 static __always_inline __u32 __swab32p(const __u32 *p)```

messages.text: I would like to resuscitate TensorBoard on Yggy <https://github.com/JuliaPackaging/Yggdrasil/pull/2266> . <@UDB26738Q>,  you said there that Bazel itself is the problem... do you have suggestions or directions on what to do?

messages.text: <https://twitter.com/andy_kelley/status/1378040840640024577>

attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/andy_kelley|@andy_kelley>: Windows has the worst possible symlink situation. They exist, so you have to account for them. But only a process with admin privileges can create them, so you can't take advantage of them.
attachments.text: Windows has the worst possible symlink situation. They exist, so you have to account for them. But only a process with admin privileges can create them, so you can't take advantage of them.

messages.text: I have a question about ARM mac binaries. I see that Rmath_jl is now built after <https://github.com/JuliaPackaging/Yggdrasil/pull/2732>, which looks pretty simple. Would it be useful to make other such PRs for various other packages, which simply wrap one library?

messages.text:
some weeks ago I mentioned here that we have a problem on musl:
```julia> using Bzip2_jll, Libdl

julia> filter(l -> occursin("bz2", l), dllist())
1-element Vector{String}:
 "/root/.julia/artifacts/0a92a1d42415185c9c716c2372d058cbacd708b7/lib/libbz2.so"

julia> using Fontconfig_jll
[ Info: Precompiling Fontconfig_jll [a3f928ae-7b40-5064-980b-68af3947d34b]
ERROR: LoadError: LoadError: InitError: could not load library "/root/.julia/artifacts/b3e68e909280ed26e93014400711a240909e609b/lib/libfreetype.so"
Error loading shared library libbz2.so.1.0: No such file or directory (needed by /root/.julia/artifacts/b3e68e909280ed26e93014400711a240909e609b/lib/libfreetype.so)```
`Bzip2_jll` dlopens `libbz2.so`,  but dependent libraries link to the soversioned library `libbz2.so.1.0` and the dynamic loader probably doesn't realised they're the same.  any idea how to work around this?  apparently someone else has realised this issue

elements.text: some weeks ago I mentioned here that we have a problem on musl:

julia> using Bzip2_jll, Libdl

julia> filter(l -> occursin("bz2", l), dllist())
1-element Vector{String}:
 "/root/.julia/artifacts/0a92a1d42415185c9c716c2372d058cbacd708b7/lib/libbz2.so"

julia> using Fontconfig_jll
[ Info: Precompiling Fontconfig_jll [a3f928ae-7b40-5064-980b-68af3947d34b]
ERROR: LoadError: LoadError: InitError: could not load library "/root/.julia/artifacts/b3e68e909280ed26e93014400711a240909e609b/lib/libfreetype.so"
Error loading shared library libbz2.so.1.0: No such file or directory (needed by /root/.julia/artifacts/b3e68e909280ed26e93014400711a240909e609b/lib/libfreetype.so)
,  but dependent libraries link to the soversioned library
and the dynamic loader probably doesn't realised they're the same.  any idea how to work around this?  apparently someone else has realised this issue

messages.text:
ok, it may be even more complicated than that:
```julia> using Libdl; dlopen("/root/.julia/artifacts/0a92a1d42415185c9c716c2372d058cbacd708b7/lib/libbz2.so.1.0"); using Fontconfig_jll
[ Info: Precompiling Fontconfig_jll [a3f928ae-7b40-5064-980b-68af3947d34b]
ERROR: LoadError: LoadError: InitError: could not load library "/root/.julia/artifacts/b3e68e909280ed26e93014400711a240909e609b/lib/libfreetype.so"
Error loading shared library libbz2.so.1.0: No such file or directory (needed by /root/.julia/artifacts/b3e68e909280ed26e93014400711a240909e609b/lib/libfreetype.so)```
`libfreetype.so` fails to load even if `libbz2.so.1.0` is explicitly dlopened :confused:

elements.text: ok, it may be even more complicated than that:

julia> using Libdl; dlopen("/root/.julia/artifacts/0a92a1d42415185c9c716c2372d058cbacd708b7/lib/libbz2.so.1.0"); using Fontconfig_jll
[ Info: Precompiling Fontconfig_jll [a3f928ae-7b40-5064-980b-68af3947d34b]
ERROR: LoadError: LoadError: InitError: could not load library "/root/.julia/artifacts/b3e68e909280ed26e93014400711a240909e609b/lib/libfreetype.so"
Error loading shared library libbz2.so.1.0: No such file or directory (needed by /root/.julia/artifacts/b3e68e909280ed26e93014400711a240909e609b/lib/libfreetype.so)

messages.text: There is a C++ package <https://github.com/cellml/libcellml/> I vaguely know about CxxWrap and have little knowledge of BinaryBuilder. I am wondering how easy it'd be to have a package that mimics this API and updates when the other one releases. Is this done with CxxWrap or creating artifacts (of which I hear much and know little). I don't want to maintain it that much. Is this possible?

elements.text: I vaguely know about CxxWrap and have little knowledge of BinaryBuilder. I am wondering how easy it'd be to have a package that mimics this API and updates when the other one releases. Is this done with CxxWrap or creating artifacts (of which I hear much and know little). I don't want to maintain it that much. Is this possible?
